content.description:
Quantum Thrust is a short, dynamic problem that ascends a slight overhang on perfect edges.

Sit start with hands matched on the oblique rail. From there, cross a right hand further up the rail to the left, hit an incut left hand gaston, set the feet, dyno to the lip (crux), and top it out.
content.protection: Bring a few pads, the problem doesn't climb high, but there are several bad rocks behind the fall zone.
content.location: It ascends the south face of Stint Block.

content.description:
Pshaw ascends a slight overhang on some of the best rock at Pink Floyd.

Sit start with hands matched on the crimp rail. From there, bump the left hand up to the second rail, set the feet, make a big deadpoint with the right hand to a gaston, edge in, reach the left hand crimp, follow to the lip, and mantle atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work, the immediate landing is good, but there are several rock behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Stint.

content.description: Stand start with a pair of underclings around waist height. From there, stand tall with a move to the lip (this could be tricky for shorter folks), reach the decent left hand edge, throw a foot over, and mantle atop the boulder (the rock is gorgeous on top).
content.protection: A pair of pads or a spot. The immediate landing is good, but there is a large, benign boulder behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Stint Block.

content.description:
Little Rapes traverses perfect rock over a poor landing.

Sit start with hands matched on the crimp rail. From there, cross over with the right hand to an edge, follow with the left hand to a sidepull/undercling, bump to a further left hand sidepull edge, then bump the left hand again to the arete, move the feet, bring the right hand over to a good edge, and finish up the remainder on the jugs to top it out.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The problem is definite lowball, but the landing has several bad rocks in the fall zone.
content.location: It traverses across the south face of Stint.
